fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31775].
  {panel}

DefaultIndexManager.hold/release can be used to temporarily postpone issue reindexing.

GreenHopper uses this feature in the epic link creation logic, as each issue otherwise gets reindexed several times which turned out to be a big 
performance issue.

Problem: In case the same issue is indexed multiple times, DIM keeps the oldest instead of the newest issue around.

I debugged the problem with [~tcampbell] and it should be a trivial fix only.
fields.summary: JIRA DefaultIndexManager.hold/release indexes wrong issue if same issue is reindexed multiple times

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce

Try to perform a JQL search longer than 2.000 characters on Chrome or Firefox. You won't be able to do so in these browser but it will work fine on IE.

h5. Current Behaviour
When searching for an Issue with JQL advanced search there is a limitation of 2.000 characters on Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox (IE works fine). 

This can cause some problems in gadgets filters or in the search itself when trying to perform a search with a long JQL query (when not using IE.)

h5. Expected Behaviour

Remove the limitation from all the browsers.

h5. WORKAROUND : 
* [POST the Query|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-31774?focusedCommentId=466114&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-466114]
* [Build up query from saved filters|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-31774?focusedCommentId=466183&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-466183]
fields.summary: JQL length limitation on Chrome and Firefox

fields.description:
A field content (native or custom) can be modified via Bulk change (Edit Issues), even if the field is not part of the EDIT screen. This is not consistent with the behavior of the simple Edit operation. When a a field is not part of the EDIT screen - it cannot be modified when the Edit button is clicked - it cannot be modified via the inline edit, but anything can be done via bulk. If a field is not part of the EDIT screen then it's because it's not supposed to be updated via any EDIT operation.

*Just to provide more detail:* In certain Jira implementations, some fields are supposed to be modified only during particular transitions. These fields are not supposed to be edited via the edit operation. In order to accomplish this we add these fields in the VIEW screen (so anybody can see the content at any time), but we don't add the fields in the EDIT screen (so these fields cannot be update via the edit operation / inline edit). The fields are added only to screens that are displayed during the transitions when the fields are supposed to be modified.
Everything works great but the problem is that if you perform a Bulk change (Edit Issues), everything can be modified, even the fields that were NOT supposed to be editable.

It would make sense to take into account the EDIT screen for all Edit operations, including Bulk Edit too.
fields.summary: Bulk change (Edit Issues) should not be possible for fields that are not part of the EDIT screen.

Thanks
Adhip

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31770].
  {panel}

Upon checking on the documentation on the columns for issue navigator, was not able to find any recent information above the usage of the Σ Original Estimate, Σ Remaining Estimate and Σ Time Spent. The only information that available back traces to the release note of Jira version 3.11 that is no longer supported.
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+3.11+Release+Notes#JIRA3.11ReleaseNotes-IssueNavigatorofferssub-taskaggregates

And according to the documentation:

{quote}Σ Original Estimate — the aggregate Original Estimate for an issue's sub-tasks.{quote}

But the actual test on the latest Jira version 5.2.6 confirms that the value of Σ Original Estimate column is different from the earlier claim. if you viewed the Original Estimate time for the Main Task, it actually includes the Original Estimate on the Main Task itself together with the Original Estimate defined on the sub tasks.

As an example:

I created a main task with an original estimate of 1 week, sub task 1 with original estimate of 1 day and sub task 2 with original estimate of 2 days. As you can see when you view the Σ Original Estimate of the Main Task, it shows 1 week 3 days instead of 3 days alone.
!originalestimate.jpg!
fields.summary: Misleading Description about Σ Original Estimate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31769].
  {panel}

# Create a new search filter
# Note that the permalink to the filter is a JQL query so will return results for anyone who clicks it
# Save the filter
# Note that the permalink to the filter is no longer a JQL query, but a link to the saved filter's ID.

Firstly, I dislike that the behaviour of the permalink button changes depending on whether your filter is a saved one or not. This is really poor user-experience, especially as it's quite easy to overlook whether you are viewing a saved filter or not.

Secondly, once a query has been saved the permalink button becomes completely non-functional unless I also share the filter with the intended recipients first. Once I've shared the filter, there is very little need for the permalink button in the first place because the intended recipients will be able to find the filter in their list of available filters. As you can only share on a group level, it can be quite tricky to work out which groups you need to share with to get all the right recipients included. You might have to share with a lot of unnecessary people, if your intended target group is quite small.

This has come about because of JRA-28914 with which I quite strongly disagree. In my opinion, the permalink button should be a *permanent link* to the *current* set of results that I'm looking at. Sharing filters is the way to get a dynamic set of results that updates if/when you change or save the filter.
fields.summary: Cannot make universally visible permalinks to saved filters / Permalink behaviour is inconsistent

At the moment, Filter or Dashboard can be share with Group, Project Roles or even Anyone if the user can create shared object. 

An improvement to this is to allow Administrator to set the sharing visibility in General Configuration to:
* Group only
* Project only
* Group and Project Only

This is something like Comment Visibility in General Configuration setting.

fields.description:
If you set the time format for time tracking to hours, for some entries the format is not respected.

+Repro steps:+
# Set time format to hours and enable time tracking for a project.
# Create an issue and enter _576.18h_ as the original estimate.
# The time displayed is wrongly as _576h 10m_ when the expected result is _576.18h_


+*Notes:*+
Anything that is more than two decimals after the divide (*_X_* minutes divided by 60) will be shown as minutes. In other words, multiplication of 3 like 3m/6m/9m/12m will all be shown as an hours-decimal format. Otherwise, it will be shown as an hours-minutes format instead.
fields.summary: Time estimates format not always respected

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31741].
  {panel}

Currently Google Apps integration only merges users that have the same username
eg.
|*JIRA*|*Google Apps*|Merge|
|jsmith|jsmith@company.com|yes|
|john.smith|jsmith@company.com|no|

Allowing administrators to pick any username to merge would help give more control over changes (such as users changing email adresses).
fields.summary: Allow any user account to be merged with Google Apps account

# As consequence, only the parent issue is moved but the sub task is still in the source project. 

h4. The root cause seems that the move issue class only get the workflow associated to the parent issue type in the target project but not the workflow associated to the sub task.

h4. Workaround
# [Convert the sub-task(s) to an issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+Sub-Task#CreatingaSub-Task-Convertingasub-tasktoastandardissue].
# Move the converted issue(s) as well as the main issue to the destination project.
# [Convert the converted issue(s) to sub-task(s) again|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+Sub-Task#CreatingaSub-Task-Convertingastandardissuetoasub-task].

h4. However...
The workaround may not be feasible when dealing with the following scenarios:
* an issue with lots of subtasks,
* lots of issues with a subtask, or
* lots of issues with lots of subtasks.
fields.summary: NPE error when moving issue with subtask in case target project has a different workflow for the subtask

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31733].
  {panel}

The current DB transaction boundaries are inconsistent:

* Many actions call DefaultIssueUpdater.doUpdate() which updates the issue and adds the change group inside one transaction but then commits it and switches to autocommit before dispatching the issue event
* Adding a comment uses DefaultCommentManager.create() which doesn't use a transaction at all
* Doing a workflow step uses OSWorkflowManager.doWorkflowAction() which does everything in one transaction
* There may be other cases that fire issue events, I haven't looked very thoroughly.

-My use case is an issue event listener that updates an activeobject which must stay in sync with the issue.  So I would like that every time the listener runs it is inside the relevant transaction not just for workflow steps.-

When making this issue I didn't notice that AOs use their own database connection so it's not that simple to get everything into one transaction.  Nonetheless this issue is something worth tidying up or at least noting in the event listener documentation.
fields.summary: Run all issue event listeners inside the database transaction that writes the issue data

*PROPOSAL:*
That would be cool if I will be able to attach screenshots from View Issue Screen by clicking the ONE button.

*CURRENT:*
Currently I need do the following:
# Capture screenshot
# Open issue in View mode
# Click "More Actions"
# Click "Attach screenshot"
# Click "Paste" button
# Click "Attach" button
# Close page
7 steps!!! But I simply want to attach screenshot after clicking the PrintScreen button without any additional settings or comments... 

*CURRENT USING FREQUENCY:*
Around 10-20 times per day or more...

*EXPECTED:*
# Capture screenshot
# Open issue in View mode
# Hit e.g:"h" button
# Close page
Profit!!!

*THOUGHTS:*
I understand that JIRA uses a Java applet to run the "Attach Screenshot" functionality in a separate browser window but I think it's OK if it will be filled in with the screenshot from clipboard and closed automatically.
If clipboard contain not an image it simply can do nothing.
Admin must be able to turn on/off this function.
Good if this feature will be as a separate Operation, this will let user ability to attach screenshot in one click - see attached PasteClipboardExample.png file (or can be placed under "More Actions").

!PasteClipboardExample.png!

fields.description:
While using the Issue Collector in other browser (Firefox, Chrome ) the attachment can be attach. However, IE9 or IE10 users can't attach file using the Issue Collector.

The Error will appear like Error.png.

Error in the log:
{code}
ERROR anonymous 555x500x1 1sqz232 127.0.0.1 /rest/collectors/1.0/tempattachment/multipart/4a6bebac [collector.plugin.rest.TemporaryAttachmentsResource] Error creating temporary attachment
java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Application Data\JIRA\caches\tmp_attachments\8121317758746025194_D:\Users\admin\Documents\durian.png (The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:194)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:145)
	at com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.rest.TemporaryAttachmentsResource.createTemporaryAttachment(TemporaryAttachmentsResource.java:228)
	at com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.rest.TemporaryAttachmentsResource.attachTemporaryFileViaForm(TemporaryAttachmentsResource.java:201)
{code}

Root Cause:
In IE9 the Internet Option > Custom Setting > "Include local directory path when uploading files to a server" is enabled. Refer to IE.png


*workaround*
In the IE9 client, disable the "Include local directory path when uploading files to a server". By default this is disabled for the "Internet" zone.
fields.summary: Issue Collector Cannot Attach File in IE9 or IE10

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31716].
  {panel}

If longer options (e.g. actual sentences) are used with Multi Select and Multi Checkboxes field types and issues are created/updated, notification emails about those fileds hardly make any sense:
!multi_checkbox.png!
!email.png!

They should show changed values instead, because custom field Options are saved as separate entities in the database and JIRA should have good knowledge which were old, which are new values and calculate the changed options based on that.

Maybe there are other custom field types affected as well, but these have impacted us the most.

How to reproduce:
# Configure a custom field of type Multi Select or Multi Checkboxes
## Add new long-text options (e.g. like in the screenshot)
# Make sure notification scheme is configured to send out notifications for (test)actions.
# Configure Email Type from your profile to be HTML
# Create an issue and update this field checking/unchecking various options

Also a side note about the appearance of these field types in Issue View - a newline between the options would be really appreciated:
!issue_view.png!
fields.summary: Several custom fields should show differences in changed values (not text diff) in notification emails

h3. Summary
At present, the notification helper (part of the admin helper plugin) doesn't take 'Component Lead' into account. So if a notification should be sent to the component lead then the user will not realise this. Could we please add 'Component Lead' to the notification helper?

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Configure SAMPLE project with a component named component:
!component.png|thumbnail!
# Configure a notification with all component lead set to all events
!notification_scheme.png|thumbnail!
# Create an issue with the component(eg. SAMPLE-232):
!issue_component.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected Result:

Notification Helper should show that user admin receive notification for any event for that issue. 

h3. Actual Result:
Notification show that user cannot receive any notification for that issue:
!notification_helper.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

There is currently no workaround for this issue.

fields.description:
I am able to set up a web hook that fires on Issue Created if I define no JQL (see GoodWebhook.png attachment), but it won't fire if I do define a JQL (see BadWebhook.png attachment). I can get it to fire on Issue Updated with our without JQL, but I need it on Issue Created.

The use case is that if a new Incident issuetype is created, that I want to fire off phone calls, emails, texts to notify the responsible parties. Because of this bug, I'm having to not define any JQL which means I have to do the filtering in the webhook itself, which wastes cycles for both JIRA and the webhook.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31673].
  {panel}

Here's the context: I had a PM leave and another take his place - I wanted to rename the user so he could just take over.  Alas, you can't do that, but that's another issue.

Instead, It appears I must take the cumbersome path of creating a new issue and transfer all of the data from one user to another. The Operations offered on the Admin User pane allow for Deleting, but when I choose that, it says I cannot, because they have issues assigned them.  After searching through the help, I discover that Atlassian "strongly recommends deactivating the user instead of deleting it since deleting a user may cause database integrity problems."  Deactivating?  First I've heard of that.

My question: Why would you put an action that you _strongly_ recommend against on the common operations list for Users??  If you want people to deactivate, put Deactivate on that list instead, instead of making people wade through your help to discover that that feature even exists.

PS - I so wish I didn't run into head-slapping issues like this every time I use Jira.  How many years has this product been actively developed?
fields.summary: Admin User pane - Delete as common operation?

fields.description:
Copied to https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STRM-2131

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Install JIRA 5.2.6
# Install Bamboo 4.4.1
# Connect Bamboo to use JIRA as userbase.
# Log into JIRA using Admin user.
# Create User2.
# Log in to Bamboo as Admin user and run a manual build.
# Log in as User2 into JIRA and check activity stream.

h3. Cause:

AS query from JIRA 5.0.4:
{noformat}
http://localhost:8085/bamboo/plugins/servlet/streams?streams=user+IS+creator&local=true&use-accept-lang=true&maxResults=10
{noformat}

AS query from JIRA 5.2.2:
{noformat}
http://localhost:8085/bamboo/plugins/servlet/streams?local=true&use-accept-lang=true&maxResults=5
{noformat}

This is not a security issue as the permissions are still checked in Bamboo. A user will only be able to see what they would have already had access to if they logged into Bamboo directly. Exception is when basic auth is used.

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian,

I have noticed in catalina.out a flood of errors like these
{code}
Error getting plugins
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Multiple plugins with the same key and version:com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting 2
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.PluginComparator.compare(PluginComparator.java:28)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.PluginComparator.compare(PluginComparator.java:7)
        at java.util.TreeMap.compare(TreeMap.java:1188)
        at java.util.TreeMap.put(TreeMap.java:531)
        at java.util.TreeSet.add(TreeSet.java:255)
        at java.util.AbstractCollection.addAll(AbstractCollection.java:334)
        at java.util.TreeSet.addAll(TreeSet.java:312)
        at com.atlassian.jira.util.system.ExtendedSystemInfoUtilsImpl.getPlugins(ExtendedSystemInfoUtilsImpl.java:643)
        at org.apache.jsp._500page_jsp._jspService(_500page_jsp.java:1195)
        at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service(HttpJspBase.java:70)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:722)
        at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServletWrapper.service(JspServletWrapper.java:432)
        at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.serviceJspFile(JspServlet.java:390)
        at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.service(JspServlet.java:334)
{code}
Likely this is thrown when an error 500 occurs but this is not the problem. The problem is that ExtendedSystemInfoUtilsImpl.getPlugins() throws an IllegalStateException when run on JDK 1.7.0_13 but not on JDK 1.6.0_39. Since we need to switch to JDK 1.7 this bug has very high priority for us to be fixed. 
The problem likely lies in the different behaviour of JRE 6 and 7 when adding elements to an empty TreeSet. The problem can be reproduced with the following code in the Groovy Script Runner
{code}
import com.atlassian.jira.util.system.ExtendedSystemInfoUtils
import com.atlassian.jira.util.system.ExtendedSystemInfoUtilsImpl;
import com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.I18nBean
import com.atlassian.plugin.Plugin

ExtendedSystemInfoUtils extendedSystemInfoUtils = new ExtendedSystemInfoUtilsImpl(new I18nBean(Locale.ENGLISH));

Collection<Plugin> plugins = extendedSystemInfoUtils.getPlugins()
{code}

I'm not sure if this behaviour came with JDK 1.7.0_13 or has been in JDK 1.7 since the beginning.

Regards,
Dieter

h3. Workaround

Move JIRA over to Java 6. Please note as per our [Supported Platforms|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms] Java 6 is not supported in JIRA 6.

# Install Java 6 JRE/JDK.
# Stop JIRA.
# Change the {{$JAVA_HOME}} to point to the Java 6 JRE/JDK.
# Clear our the plugin cache, as it is Java version dependent (starting up will cause failures if we don't clear it). To do so, remove the following directories:
{noformat}
$JIRA_HOME/plugins/.bundled_plugins
$JIRA_HOME/plugins/.osgi_plugins
{noformat}
(i) These are temporary files and folders and will be recreated when JIRA starts.
# Start JIRA.
# Test you can create a Support Email.
fields.summary: JDK 1.7 incompatibility: ExtendedSystemInfoUtilsImpl.getPlugins() throws IllegalStateException

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31664].
  {panel}

Currently the JQL earliestUnreleasedVersion returns results with versions that are archived, but unreleased.
* Reported on 5.1.3
* Verified on 5.2.5

To reproduce:
* Create a version in JIRA (say *v1*)
* Create new issue
** fill in affected version field to: *v1*
* Archive the *v1* version
* JQL for affectedVersion = earliestUnreleasedVersion()
* Notice that the new issue with *v1* is displayed

Expect: That issues relating to *v1* is not displayed, since that version has been archived

See screenshots for further clarification
fields.summary: JQL earliestUnreleasedVersion is returning unreleased archived versions
Timesheets gadget should use short date format

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31661].
  {panel}

The default style has (for me) excessive spacing (7px and 5px padding on all tables). This requires scrolling all the time within gadgets and on the screen itself. This is awkward and time consuming. Also all the buttons and icons etc are huge.

For example, in JIRA 3 I could see 2 weeks of timesheets on screen at once. In the new time sheet I have to scroll vertically and horizontally. (I'm using a 24 inch screen in hi resolution).

It is very difficult in issue lists and other tables to quickly see data without scrolling back and forth.

A compact style e.g. (2px, 2px padding on tables etc) would help user see all data.

My current workaround is to use GreaseMonkey (Firefox) and TamperMonkey (Chrome) to change the styles, but a compact style (like gmail) would make using JIRA much more efficient.
fields.summary: JIRA Layout and style is too spaced out (requires constant scrolling) - request a "Compact" style
put a close button at the top of the New In Jira x.y popup

The root cause of the issue is that the email address data in the table cwd_user is having a NULL value. 

The real cause of the issue is that the (lower_)email_address columns in the database is using data type long-varchar which reflect to data type VARCHAR2 in ORACLE, and this type of data convert automatically the empty string to NULL (as by designe of ORACLE database server).

The same issue did not reproduce with PostgreSQL and MYSQL.

*Steps to reproduce*:

# go to _Administrations > Projects > select the project > Workflow tab_ and it will shows:

fields.description:
If JIRA is not compatible with JDK7, it would be nice for AMPS to error out early and inform the user that JDK7 isn't supported.  I was wondering if this was something I'd done wrong...

My environment:
* AMPS 4.1.4
* Oracle JDK 1.7.0_07
* Reproduced on OS X and Linux

Steps to reproduce:
# {{atlas-create-jira-plugin}}
#* Selected JIRA 5.0 plugin 
# {{atlas-run}} from within the new plugin directory

Results:
* {{atlas-run}} reports "JIRA startup failed, JIRA has been locked."
* See attached log file for errors, the first one being:

fields.description:
Both the CurrentReporterHasCreatePermission and CurrentAssigneeHasAssignablePermission permissions should implement the getUsers() method.

h5. Steps to reproduce
{quote}
Uncomment the setting, after this, restart jira and configure your system to use it.

- Enable {{com.atlassian.jira.security.type.CurrentReporterHasCreatePermission}} setting in /opt/atlassian/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/permission-types.xml

- Modify your schema permission:

Add to browse project : Reporter creator (after enabling the CurrentReporterHasCreatePermission, a new option appears)

- Add {{Project Role (Developers)}} to {{Browse Project}} and {{Project Role (Users)}} to {{Create Issues}} in the default Permission Scheme.

- You must have 2 users, 4 groups and 2 projects:

- New groups: userA, userB, developerA, developerB

- User A must be included in group userA, developerA, jira-user and jira-developer

- User B must be included in group userB, developerB, jira-user and jira-developer

- Project A developers group must be set to the new group developersA

- Project A user group must be set to the new group userA

- Project A must left unassigned the new issues

- Project B developers group must be set to the new group developersB

- Project B user group must be set to the new group userB

- Project B must left unassigned the new issues

- User A is user and developer in project A. He can explore and work project A.

- User A cannot view issues in project B. He will see the project B. The CurrentReporterHasCreatePermission give him permission to open issues in project B and follow his issues, but only these

- User B is user and developer in project B

- User B cannot view issues in project A. He will see the project A. The CurrentReporterHasCreatePermission give him permission to open issues in project A and follow his issues, but only these

After you have that working, and have some issues, try to access the Gant Chart option and you will get the following error.
{quote}


{noformat}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31646].
  {panel}

I'm the maintainer of the Sauce Connector plugin for Jira (https://marketplace.atlassian.com/manage/plugins/net.customware.plugins.connector.saucelabs.saucelabs-connector-plugin)

The plugin is currently available to Jira OnDemand users and we've just released a new version which fixes an error with the 'Test Connection' function, and we'd like to make this version available to Jira OnDemand customers (version 1.1 is currently available to OnDemand users, and 1.3 is the latest version).

Would it be possible to the version of the plugin updated within Jira OnDemand?

Edit: version 1.3 is the latest version to use, not version 1.2
fields.summary: Update to the Sauce Connector plugin for Jira OnDemand
